issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.reddit.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.reddit.com%2F) ### Comment > This Google popup appears on multiple websites. I have used the Adguard Browser Assistant many times to block it to no avail. The Assistant no longer recognizes the popup when I move the cursor over it... > > On the same Reddit website using Brave browser and Adguard web based blocker, the Google ad is blocked... ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/mft7dwtcfuowgw4o8kokokkcoskck00rh3rlpuifkg.jpg?nc=1)

issue.title: stwater.co.uk
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Content Blocker

### AdGuard version

2.1.72.49

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly, Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.stwater.co.uk/in-my-area/check-my-area/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Comment

When any of the filters listed are enabled, the page doesn't load and only returns a white screen. This is blocking a cookie screen that is needed to progress to the next screen.

* AdGuard Annoyances filter
* AdGuard – Cookie Notices

2. Screenshots

* Filters enabled - https://i.imgur.com/obNwjhA.png
* Filters disabled - https://i.imgur.com/mAZBdV3.png

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: @jellizaveta It's up-to-you, but can you investigate why the rule doesn't work?

It's not always like this form. I suggest
```
/?rb=*&zoneid=$all,third-party
&zoneid=*&rb=$all,third-party
```

comment.body:
> Hello. Could you please clear the filtering log in the AdGuard app, repeat the ads in the app and send screenshots of the filtering log while the app is running?

I'm not sure if this is what you're looking for,but I found something similar in the code,so I took screenshots of them.
Furthermore, I encountered a situation in the app where, due to accidentally tapping on a location near the center of the screen,
it redirected me to download an APK file within the advertised content. The advertisements in question are from different websites each time, 
including the likes of JD.com,pinduoduo.com, and various other types of ads.
![12660_0](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/108153456/d80be060-e68b-4b10-89e3-91bc04a55907)
